es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command
Class Command

java.lang.Object
  es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.Command
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CloseCommand, CommandMock, DropCommand, ExamineCommand, GoCommand, HelpCommand, LookCommand, OpenCommand, QuitCommand, TakeCommand, UndoCommand
public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Represents an abstract command from the player (following the Command pattern). Specific commands know how to parse themselves into a string, clone themselves, execute themselves, undo themselves and print their own help.

  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.command.failure" which default value is "Execution failure: ".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.command.undoSuccess" which default value is "Undo success: ".

msgCommandUndoSuccess

private java.lang.String msgCommandUndoSuccess

game

protected Game game
A reference to a game object. It will be useful for accessing the room where the player stays, for manipulating the player inventory and for printing messages.

Constructor Detail

Command

public Command(Game game)
Constructs a command that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed, unexecuted and its configuration has no properties.

Parameters:
game - The game.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'game' cannot be null.

private void setDefaultConfiguration()

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Clones this command, returning a shallow copy of itself (following the Prototype pattern and the conventions of the clone method of Java Object).

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
See Also:
Object.clone()

execute

public boolean execute()
Executes the command. By default, the execution of a command is unsuccessful (nothing is done but showing the undo failure message).

Returns:
true if the command has been correctly executed; false otherwise.
Throws:
UnparsedCommandException - This command has not been parsed so it cannot be executed.

hasResult

public boolean hasResult()
Checks whether there is a result of the execution (or undoing) of this command.

Returns:
true if there is a result; false otherwise.
Throws:
UnparsedCommandException - This command has not been parsed so it cannot have a result.
UnexecutedCommandException - This command has not been executed so it cannot have a result.

getResult

public java.lang.String getResult()
Gets the result of the execution of this command. This 'result' is implemented as a simple text that can be shown to the player, giving information about the last executed command (i.e. whether an item have been taken or not, after a Take command).

Returns:
The result of the execution.
Throws:
UnparsedCommandException - This command has not been parsed so it cannot have a result.
UnexecutedCommandException - This command has not been executed so it cannot have a result.
NoCommandResultException - The execution of this command had no result.

undo

public boolean undo()
Undoes the command execution. By default, the undo of the execution of a command is successful (nothing is done but showing the undo success message).

Returns:
true if the command has been correctly undone; false otherwise.
Throws:
UnparsedCommandException - This command has not been parsed so it cannot be undone.
UnexecutedCommandException - This command has not been executed so it cannot be undone.

getHelp

public abstract java.lang.String getHelp()
Gets the help information about this command.

Returns:
The help information.

parse

public abstract boolean parse(java.lang.String line)
Parses a text line trying to identify a player invocation to this command.

Parameters:
line - The text line.
Returns:
true if the text line has been correctly parsed and the command correctly configured; false otherwise.

toString

public abstract java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation for this object, depending on the type of specific command. This is useful for debugging purposes.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
